intro: Cissampelos consociata, commonly known as the clustered moon vine, is a climbing plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its botanical features include a milky sap and a complex root system that helps it thrive in various soil types. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
